root.name: JoJo's Venture
root.description: OverviewJoJo's Venture (known in Japan as JoJo no Kimyouna Bouken, translated to JoJo's Bizarre Adventure) is a 2D fighting game developed and released by Capcom for arcades on December 2, 1998. Based on the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure manga (more specifically, the Stardust Crusaders arc), JoJo's Venture stars Jotaro Kujo, a Japanese teenager who must use his bizarre supernatural powers (known as the "stand") to defeat an ancestral enemy to his family, the vampire Dio Brando. The game would quickly get an upgrade in the form of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure less than a year later, as well as inclusion in the Dreamcast release of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is the fourth of the six games released for the short-lived CPS-3 hardware (which include JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, Red Earth, and the Street Fighter III trilogy).
